content:
• Tuesday, June 12, 2018
  • S

    Jefferies: AT&T decision doesn't make Sprint/T-Mobile road any easier

    • Sprint and T-Mobile are among the wide number of stocks moving after hours in response to AT&T's smackdown of the Justice Dept., on hopes that they'll benefit from a tide favoring communications/media mergers.
    • Not so fast, Jefferies says of a judicial opinion that seemed more focused on the weakness of the DOJ's case than on the philosophical/antitrust merits of the combination overall.
    • The proposed Sprint/T-Mobile merger presents "significantly higher" antitrust concerns, analyst Scott Goldman writes: "We do not anticipate the DOJ to be swayed by its loss in the AT&T litigation." But T-Mobile is still a top pick, attractively valued with or without the deal, he says. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Meanwhile, Sprint is a Hold rather than Buy, he writes.
    • Currently: S +2.8%; TMUS +1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 PM | 29 Comments
  • SMG

    Scotts Miracle-Gro lawn and garden purchases hit record $565M in May

    • Scotts Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG) +1.5% after-hours as it reports consumer purchases of its lawn and garden products surged 28% to a record $565M in May, resulting in the near full recovery of the decline reported through the first seven months of FY 2018.
    • SMG says YTD purchases in the U.S. consumer segment are now nearly flat from 2017 with positive growth in lawn fertilizer, grass seed, growing media and mulch.
    • SMG now expects to report full-year sales in a range of flat to 2% higher Y/Y compared with a previous range of 2%-4% growth, assuming a 1%-3% decline in U.S. consumer sales vs. a previous projection of flat to 2% growth; sales in the Hawthorne segment are expected to rise 25%-30%, driven by the recently completed Sunlight Supply acquisition.
    • SMG sees non-GAAP adjusted EPS of $3.70-$3.90, including dilution of $0.30-$0.40 associated with the Sunlight transaction, vs. $3.96 consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM | 4 Comments
  • ERJ

    Bloomberg: Embraer, Boeing deal talks in final stage

    • Embraer (NYSE:ERJ) +2.4% after-hours following a 5.9% spike into today's close after Brazil's Pres. Temer endorsed in principle Boeing’s (NYSE:BA) proposed commercial jet venture with the company, according to a Bloomberg report.
    • Temer reportedly gave his blessing after Brazil’s Air Force, defense minister and secretary of strategic affairs approved the deal; his approval would be a crucial step since the Brazilian government has veto power over any ERJ tie-up.
    • Negotiators for BA and ERJ have reached agreement on most issues and are now discussing some remaining details that amount to ~10% of the terms, Bloomberg reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM | 5 Comments
  • T

    Aftermarket trade ripples run wide from AT&T/Time Warner decision

    • What's going on in aftermarket for stocks of other companies linked to large M&A deals after AT&T's (NYSE:T) decisive victory over the government in its pursuit of Time Warner (NYSE:TWX)?
    • Along with mergers in other sectors like healthcare, most eyes are on media deals that are closer to the action. Comcast is likely to launch a formal competing cash bid of around $60B for the media assets of Twenty-First Century Fox as soon as tomorrow, setting up a wrestling match with Disney for the prized content. After hours: CMCSA -4%; FOX +6.5%, FOXA +6.9%; DIS -1.5%.
    • Comcast also is in pursuit of Sky (OTCPK:SKYAY), also being sought by part-owner Fox as well as Disney (depending on how/when Disney's deal for Fox shakes out).
    • Sprint and T-Mobile are likely celebrating, since a rejection of the vertical combo of AT&T/Time Warner would have put a massive chill on their proposed horizontal tie-up. After hours: S +3.4%, TMUS +1.6%.
    • CBS -- currently locked in an internal struggle over directives to look at re-merging with Viacom -- could re-evaluate its position, as could Viacom. In late trading, CBS +4.6%; VIA +5.1%, VIAB +4.3%.
    • Lions Gate Entertainment is seen as a likely merger partner with ... someone, as one of a dwindling number of content firms in the medium-sized space; LGF.A +7.6%; LGF.B +9.5%.
    • Discovery (NASDAQ:DISCA), another likely merger candidate, is up 3.7% in late trading.
    • Sinclair Broadcast Group (NASDAQ:SBGI) and Tribune Media (NYSE:TRCO) will press for government approval of their merger, which had previously run afoul of broadcast station ownership concentration rules. SBGI +1.5%; TRCO +1.4%.
    • And Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX), potentially facing a new streaming world with other companies marshaling resources to fight its dominance, is off 0.9% postmarket.
    • Currently after hours, with some arbitrage going on: T -2.3%; TWX +4.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM | 166 Comments
  • APPS

    Digital Turbine -5.3% as heavy revenue growth still disappoints

    • Digital Turbine (NASDAQ:APPS) is 5.3% lower after hours following fiscal Q4 results where revenues missed despite an 80% Y/Y move.
    • The company's listed its Content and Advertisers & Publishers businesses as discontinued operations after agreements to divest them.
    • Revenues grew to $21M, mainly with growth from large pre-existing carrier partners as well as some incremental contribution from new carrier/OEM partners.
    • Net loss narrowed to $4.2M from a year-ago loss of $5.8M (GAAP basis); non-GAAP net loss narrowed to $0.6M from a loss of $1.5M.
    • Adjusted EBITDA, meanwhile, was about zero vs. a year-ago loss of $0.8M.
    • Ignite installations have passed 155M total devices.
    • Cash balance came to $12.7M as of March 31, vs. $6.9M at Dec. 31.
    • It's guiding to Q1 revenue of about $23M, and positive non-GAAP adjusted EBITDA.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 3 Comments

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/12/2018)

    • Top gainers: ENPH +28.5%. FOXA +6.4%. DISCA +4.1%. ESRX +4.9%. TWX +4.5%.

  • COMM

    CommScope reaffirms Q2, FY guidance ahead of tomorrow's investor day

    • CommScope (NASDAQ:COMM) reaffirms its Q2 and FY18 guidance ahead of the investor day event tomorrow.
    • Q2 expects revenue of $1.21B to $1.26B and EPS of $0.63 to $0.68. Non-GAAP operating income is from $230M to $250M and the adjusted effective tax rate from 29% to 30%. 
    • FY18 guidance has $4.675B to $4.825B and EPS from $2.33 to $2.48. Non-GAAP adjusted operating income is from $870M to $920M and effective tax rate from 29% to 30%. Cash flow from operations expected under $550M. 
    • The investor day event starts tomorrow at 9:30 AM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • CommScope shares are flat aftermarket at $30.24.  
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • CVS

    Mega-merger healthcare players up on positive court ruling for AT&T/Time Warner tie-up

    • Would-be merger partners CVS Health (NYSE:CVS) and Aetna (NYSE:AET), up 2% and 3%, respectively, after hours, and Cigna (NYSE:CI) and Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX), up 1% and 5%, respectively, after hours, perk up in response to the news that a federal judge has signed off on the legality of the $85.4B merger between AT&T and Time Warner. Not only that, Judge Richard Leon did not impose any conditions on the marriage.
    • Last year, the U.S. Justice Department sued to block the deal for anti-competitive reasons.
    • The development bodes well for the two giant healthcare mergers.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 13 Comments
  • T

    AT&T win combines tremendous reach with vast TWX content

    • AT&T has won a stunning victory in its multibillion-dollar effort to create a content/distribution juggernaut, and combines the country's top multichannel video service provider with a content empire ranging from the prestige dramas of HBO through the Warner Bros. film studio and TV channels including TBS and CNN.
    • The decision came about 19 minutes ago, and AT&T (NYSE:T) is now down 1.8% after hours. Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) is up 5%, quoting to $101.
    • The verdict is a blow to DOJ antitrust chief Makan Delrahim, who signaled a new approach to deal enforcement with his challenge to the merger in November.
    • In reaction, Delrahim says he's disappointed with the decision, and that it makes a less competitive pay TV market, but that he'll stick to his mission to protect consumers. He'll review the decision before announcing any next steps.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 82 Comments
  • VTVT

    Vtv Therapeutics' azeliragon flunks late-stage Alzheimer's study; shares halted

    • Nano cap vTv Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VTVT) is set for a significant down move on the news that Part B of its Phase 3 STEADFAST study assessing azeliragon in people with mild Alzheimer's disease failed to achieve the co-primary endpoints. Specifically, scores on two metrics, ADAS-cog and CDR-sb, did not separate sufficiently from placebo in participants with maximal azeliragon plasma concentrations of less than 7.5 ng/mL.
    • People with lower maximal plasma concentrations of azeliragon in Part B did show improvements in efficacy versus placebo based on an analysis of pooled data from Parts A and B and comparing the change from baseline at month 12.
    • The company says it plans to discuss the data with the FDA aimed at clarifying an accelerated approval pathway.
    • Shares will resume trading at 5:00 pm ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 7 Comments
  • T

    AT&T prevails in Time Warner merger trial, without conditions

    • Judge Richard Leon has found for AT&T (NYSE:T) in the telecom giant's landmark trial over an $80B-plus buyout of Time Warner (NYSE:TWX), allowing the blockbuster deal to proceed without remedies.
    • The decision also signals a likely green light for more and faster media consolidation, most notably potential competing bids for the media assets of Fox (FOX, FOXA) from Disney (NYSE:DIS) and Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA), and bids for European broadcaster Sky (OTCPK:SKYAY) from some permutation of Disney, Fox and Comcast.
    • AT&T had previously indicated that with the lengthy time involved in the deal, it was prepared to close quickly if it got a clear go-ahead in this case, so we expect to hear details very quickly.
    • Updated: Judge Leon has also said he would deny a stay on the deal if requested by the Justice Dept., meaning that even if DOJ appeals, the companies are free to close. That could discourage an appeal entirely.
    • Time Warner is up 3.9% after hours; AT&T down 1.2%.
    • Updated 4:45 p.m.:  FOXA is up 4.8% after hours; CMCSA is down 4% postmarket.
    • Updated 5:57 p.m.: Read the 172-page opinion in United States v. AT&T et al.
      •  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 250 Comments
  • PBYI

    Oral hearing June 26 for Puma Bio's request for relook at rejected neratinib application; shares up 2% after hours

    • The European Medicines Agency's advisory group CHMP will conduct an oral hearing on June 26 during which Puma Biotechnology (NYSE:PBYI) may present its rationale for a re-examination of its marketing application seeking approval for neratinib for HER2-positive breast cancer.
    • Shares are up 2% after hours.
    • Previously: European advisory group thumbs down on Puma Bio's Nerlynx; shares down 2% premarket (Feb. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 4 Comments
  • PVTL

    Pivotal Software +5.4% on Q1 beats, upside FY guidance

    • Pivotal Software (NYSE:PVTL) shares are up 5.4% aftermarket on the first earnings report since the IPO. Q1 results beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 29% Y/Y revenue growth. Q2 guidance has revenue from $157M to $159M (consensus: $152.81M) and EPS from -$0.10 to -$0.09 (consensus: -$0.10).
    • Upside FY19 guidance has revenue from $642M to $649M (consensus: $622.03M) and EPS from -$0.39 to -$0.37 (consensus: -$0.45). 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Pivotal Software beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (June 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM

  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy to buy SunPower’s microinverter business

    • Enphase Energy (NASDAQ:ENPH) +16% after-hours following news it has agreed to acquire SunPower’s (NASDAQ:SPWR) microinverter business for $25M in cash and 7.5M ENPH common shares.
    • The companies say the five-year agreement will accelerate global adoption of AC Modules as the de facto residential solution.
    • ENPH says it expects to add $60M-$70M in annualized revenue in H2 2019 at a 33%-35% gross margin.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 70 Comments

  • SLB

    Schlumberger sees 10%-15% profit growth in Q2 but shares slide

    • Schlumberger (SLB -2.3%) is lower after outlining expectations for 10%-15% EPS growth in Q2 and a 12%-13% increase in North America revenues during a presentation at a Wells Fargo energy conference in San Francisco.
    • SLB sees international revenues rising 6%-7% but with lower than expected revenue growth in the Middle East due to delays and drilling challenges related to the start of projects in Saudi Arabia, Iraq and India.
    • SLB says it is mobilizing 30 rigs internationally this quarter and expects to mobilize an additional 25 rigs in Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 5 Comments
  • JD

    Bloomberg: JD.com setting up for Thailand expansion

    • JD.com (JD +3.9%) is building infrastructure for an expansion into Thailand in coming months, Bloomberg reports.
    • It's building fulfillment centers there and will deploy a delivery fleet in Bangkok while tapping third parties to help with deliveries in other parts of the country.
    • Most of its current 15-warehouse capacity is dedicated to importing goods into China. Some 85% of packages through its own network in Indonesia are now delivered within 24 hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 25 Comments
  • GOOG

    Google, Facebook, Twitter face new House panel hearing

    • It's back to the Hill for major tech giants.
    • The House Judiciary Committee is recalling representatives from Google (GOOG +0.6%, GOOGL +0.5%), Facebook (FB +0.9%) and Twitter (TWTR +6.3%) to testify June 26 in a hearing it's planning to address anti-conservative bias, Bloomberg notes.
    • Yesterday, Facebook delivered 450 pages of documents that purported to answer questions that Mark Zuckerberg couldn't address during appearances before House and Senate panels in April.
    • It's been a spring of testimony for representatives of the companies in the wake of the Cambridge Analytica privacy scandal and growing scrutiny of how they manage user privacy and treat news dissemination.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 24 Comments

    Intelsat rebounds 6.7% after pricing shares, notes

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) is up 6.7% in NYSE trading after last night's pricing of dual offerings of shares and convertible notes.
    • That's a rebound from a 10% decline Monday.
    • Shares have been on a relatively precipitous climb in 2018, up 549% from a 52-week low of $2.44 in early February.

  • TYME

    Tyme Technologies' SM-88 shows anti-tumor effect across range of cancers; shares up 10%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Tyme Technologies (TYME +9.6%) is up on below-average volume in response to its release of patient data on lead candidate SM-88.
    • In 83 evaluable patients from the First Human Study and Compassionate Use Program, the objective response rates (ORR) were 33% and 45%, respectively, across 15 different cancer types. The ORR in breast cancer patients was 44% (n=11/25), including two of five with triple negative breast cancer.
    • 40% (n=33/83) of patients experienced stable cancer with median overall survival of 43 months (time period: late 2011 into 2017).
    • The company says it remains focused on completing its ongoing clinical trials and will consider expanding development of SM-88 into additional cancers.
    • SM-88 is a combination therapy that uses a proprietary dysfunctional tyrosine derivative to interrupt the metabolic processes of cancer cells, breaking down their defenses and making them vulnerable to oxidative stress and death.
    • Previously: Tyme's lead candidate SM-88 shows treatment effect in mid-stage prostate cancer study; shares ahead 4% (Feb. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • SITO

    Sito Mobile -15% on new Q2 revenue guidance

    • Sito Mobile (NASDAQ:SITO) has slid 15.2% after revising expectations on Q2 revenues.
    • It now expects revenues for the quarter ending June 30 to fall in the $8M-$9M range; that's down from Q1's $11.1M.
    • “We continue to advance the transition of our business from more traditional media delivery services with one-time, monthly campaign revenue to high-value consumer behavior research and media placement services for large enterprise brands and key agencies in order to deliver recurring revenue over many months," says CEO Tom Pallack in commenting on the revision.
    • "We are confident this transition will best position SITO for continued success over the long-term, despite the near-term challenges of revenue performance and predictability. We remain optimistic about the opportunities for growth in 2018.”
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • LMNR

    Limoneira down 11% post Q2 results

    • Limoneira (LMNR -11.3%) reported Q2 revenue growth of 17% Y/Y to $43.14M due to higher lemon sales.
    • Segment sales: Agribusiness $41.85M (+18.2% Y/Y) and rental operations $1.27M (-14% Y/Y).
    • Agribusiness revenue includes $33.6M (+28.2% Y/Y) in lemon sales, ~1.16M cartons at an average price of $23.48 per carton were sold in the quarter.
    • Q2 operating margin improved by 491 bps to 21.75% and Adj. EBITDA margin improved by 424 bps to 25.52%.
    • Q2 total cost and expenses were up by 10.1% Y/Y to $33.8M reflecting increase in agribusiness and overall costs.
    • FY18 Outlook: EPS $0.65-0.75; operating income $15.7-17.8M; EBITDA $23-25M and LMNR expects to sell between 3.1-3. 3M cartons of lemons at an average price of ~$24.5 per carton and ~6-6.5M pounds of avocados at ~$1.3 per pound.
    • Previously: Limoneira beats by $0.02, misses on revenue (June 11)

    Piper Jaffray checks show strong Q2 for iRobot; shares +7.5%

  • SHLDQ

    Sears higher after expanding Amazon tire installation program

    • Sears Holdings (SHLD) is up 8.71% after expanding its tire partnership with Amazon.
    • The company says the Amazon tire installation partnership is now in 118 stores, up from the initial 47 locations.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 23 Comments
  • ENBL

    Enable Midstream upgraded, Targa and DCP Midstream cut at Barclays

    • Enable Midstream Partners (ENBL +2%) is higher after Barclays upgrades shares to Equal Weight from Underweight with a $17 price target, raised from $14, saying ENBL is poised to benefit over the coming quarters from a shifting U.S. production outlook.
    • Anadarko Petroleum's positive results and revised expectations for Haynesville reflect ENBL's intention to deploy capital in basins that are less hampered by infrastructure constraints than the Permian Basin, says Barclays analyst Christine Cho.
    • At the same time, Barclays downgrades Targa Resources (TRGP -1.6%) to Equal Weight from Overweight with a $52 price target and DCP Midstream (DCP +0.1%) to Underweight from Equal Weight with a $39 target.
    • Cho is optimistic on TRGP's Q2 estimates thanks to robust volumes but is concerned about Permian volumes over the next 12-18 months, and notes that DCP trades at a slight premium to the G&P group average despite having no distribution growth and coverage of ~1x.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • DLTR

    Credit Suisse defends Dollar Tree

    • Credit Suisse updates on Dollar Tree (DLTR +3.2%) after last month's Q1 earnings report from the retailer sent shares lower.
    • The analyst team thinks investors are negative over the results of the Family Dollar integration in particular.
    • "Whereas results have not been anywhere near initial expectations when the deal closed almost 3 years ago, we believe sentiment is overly negative and that risk/reward actually skews to the upside. A sum-of-the-parts valuation, recent ramp in remodel activity, and potentially opportune timing in the economic cycle lead us to reiterate our Outperform rating," writes analyst Judah Frommer and team.
    • CS says its price target of $93 on Dollar Tree is ~15.5X its near-term EPS estimate.
    • Previously: Dollar Tree sheds 8% after weak profit guidance (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • XENE

    Xenon Pharma continues northward march, up 15%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Xenon Pharmaceuticals (XENE +14.5%) is up on almost 60% higher volume, albeit on turnover of only 220K shares, building on its extended rally. Shares have nearly tripled this year.
    • The company develops therapies for neurological disorders. Pipeline candidates include XEN1101 and XEN901 for epilepsy, XEN007 for hemiplegic migraine and GDC-0310 for pain (with Genentech).
    • Previously: Xenon Pharma up 21% premarket on positive XEN1101 data (May 15)

  • XOM

    Exxon, Plains to partner on Permian pipeline project

    • Exxon Mobil (XOM -0.4%) says it plans to create a joint venture with Plains All American Pipeline (PAA +2%) to construct a multibillion-dollar pipeline to carry oil and condensate from the Permian Basin to the Texas Gulf Coast.
    • XOM earlier this year said it planned to triple its oil and gas production in the Permian by 2025 while also spending more than $2B on transportation and terminal upgrades in west Texas, including expanding its crude oil terminal in Wink; the JV pipeline with PAA would originate in Wink.
    • PAA and Magellan Midstream Partners recently expanded their BridgeTex oil pipeline, which has served as the major artery from west Texas to the Houston region, but Permian oil production is at a record high and the lack of pipelines has created bottlenecks.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 19 Comments
  • DIN

    Dine Brands rides IHOb buzz higher

    • Dine Brands Global (NYSE:DIN) is up 2.58% as the company is getting some credit from investors for its IHOb marketing stunt.
    • The strategy to "temporarily" change the name of the IHOP chain to IHOb drew the social media firestorm that was planned for ahead of the roll-out of new hamburger menu items.
    • Shares of Dine Brands are up about 8% over the last week.
    • Previously: Meet IHOb - the 'b' is for burgers (June 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 2 Comments
  • GLMD

    Nash players perk up on Galmed surge

    • Money flow has perked up in certain NASH players after Galmed Pharmaceuticals (GLMD +183.4%) reported positive results on Aramchol this morning.

    Movado falls after Sidoti cut

    • Movado (MOV -3.4%) slides after Sidoti drops its rating on the apparel stock to Neutral from Buy on a call tied to valuation.
    • The investment firm sets a price target of $57 on Movado.

  • NXPI

    NXP Semiconductors -1.8% after Senate pushback on ZTE ban lift

    • NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) drops 1.8% after the report that the U.S. Senate is prepared for a showdown with the White House over the ZTE ban lift.
    • Qualcomm’s (NASDAQ:QCOM) acquisition of NXP still requires the approval of Chinese regulators and the market is reacting to any indication of easing or worsening tensions between the nations.

    • Adjusted results from operating activities was C$(2.4)M (+71.4% Y/Y).
    • “We have a sharp focus on driving traffic into our stores and to our new online platform, delivering an exceptional customer experience in both.   • PSTI

    Pluristem's PLX-PAD cells successful in mid-stage IC study; shares ahead 14% premarket

    • Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) is up 14% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing its PLX-PAD cells in patients with a type of peripheral arterial disease called intermittent claudication (IC).
    • The study met the primary endpoint of a statistically valid change from baseline in maximal walking distance at week 52 versus placebo.
    • Patients in the treatment group experienced 49% less risk of revascularization (hazard ratio = 0.51). Also, intramuscular administration of PLX-PAD was safe and well-tolerated.
    • A pivotal Phase 3 study in critical limb ischemia is ongoing. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated completion date is May 2020.

    Galmed to release mid-stage data on NASH candidate Aramchol this morning; shares up 60% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Galmed Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:GLMD) is up 60% premarket on light volume ahead of its 8:00 am ET conference call to discuss topline results from its Phase 2b ARREST study assessing Aramchol (arachidyl amido cholanoic acid) in nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).
    • Previously: Galmed's Aramchol flunks mid-stage NAFLD study (Feb. 14)
    • Update: The company says 400 mg of Aramchol demonstrated a statistically significant reduction in liver fat versus placebo as determined by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). Significantly more patients receiving 600 mg of Aramchol experienced NASH resolution without worsening fibrosis, a regulatory approvable endpoint. Also, a higher proportion of patients treated with the 600 mg dose experienced at least a one-point improvement in fibrosis score without worsening of NASH, another regulatory approvable endpoint. Statistically significant reductions in liver enzymes ALT and AST were observed in both dose cohorts compared to placebo. The safety profile was favorable. Shares are up 170% premarket on robust volume.
